meanings.sent1: The frog jumped over the puddle.
meanings.sent2: The cat jumped onto the table.
meanings.sent3: The kangaroo jumped happily in the zoo.
meanings.sent4: Her heart jumped with joy when she saw the surprise.
meanings.sent5: The basketball player jumped high to score a slam dunk.

meanings.sent1: She jumped out of bed when the alarm rang.
meanings.sent2: The squirrel jumped from tree to tree in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a picnic jumped into her mind out of nowhere.
meanings.sent4: The news of the sale jumped through the office like wildfire.
meanings.sent5: The horse suddenly jumped over the fence to escape.

meanings.sent1: He jumped at the chance to go on an adventure.
meanings.sent2: The cat jumped onto the counter to steal a treat.
meanings.sent3: The surprise party really jumped out at her.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected question jumped out during the interview.
meanings.sent5: The opportunity to travel abroad jumped into her life unexpectedly.

meanings.definition: To increase in amount or level.
meanings.sent1: The price of the house jumped after the renovations.
meanings.sent2: The temperature jumped by ten degrees in just an hour.
meanings.sent3: The excitement in the room jumped when the celebrity arrived.
meanings.sent4: Her heart rate jumped when she heard the unexpected news.
meanings.sent5: The demand for the product jumped after the advertisement campaign.
